meanings.definition: The act or process of emerging or developing.
meanings.sent1: The eclosions of the flowers in spring bring joy to all.
meanings.sent2: The eclosions of new ideas can lead to great discoveries.
meanings.sent3: The eclosions of laughter filled the room as the joke spread.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for painting had an eclosion that amazed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The eclosions of colors in the sunset painted the sky beautifully.

meanings.sent1: The eclosions of fireworks lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The eclosions of applause filled the theater after the performance.
meanings.sent3: The eclosions of excitement were contagious among the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The news of the victory caused an eclosion of celebration in the town.
meanings.sent5: The eclosions of cheers echoed through the stadium after the winning goal.
